Detailed Description

Tau-Leaping Algorithm.

This class is a subclass of class BaseSystem. This class provides function which uses variations of Tau-Leaping method to simulate reaction systems. It provided Explicit Tau Leaping, Implicit Tau Leaping and Adaptive Tau Leaping method.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef numerical::PoissonGeneratorExpInvAcNorm TauLeaping::Generator_Poisson [private]

type define the poisson random number generator.

Use the default number type (double) and default generators.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

TauLeaping::TauLeaping (  ) 

default constructor

Create a system with zero species.

TauLeaping::TauLeaping ( int  sp,
int  rxn 
)

constructor

Create a system with sp number of species and rxn number of reactions.

Parameters:
sp an integer argument, indicating the number of species in the system.
rxn an integer argument, indicating the number of reactions in the system.
curr_time a double argument, set the current time of the system, default to be zero.
end_time a double argument, set the end time of the system, default to be zero.

TauLeaping::TauLeaping ( StochVector &  sv,
StoichiometryMatrix &  nu 
)

constructor

Create a system with an initial StochVector and a StochiometryMatrix holding same value with sv and nu respectively.

Parameters:
sv a StochVector type argument.
nu a StochiometryMatrix type argument.
curr_time a double argument, set the current time of the system, default to be zero.
end_time a double argument, set the end time of the system, default to be zero.

TauLeaping::~TauLeaping (  )  [virtual]

destructor

Used to free the poisson random number generator

Member Function Documentation

void TauLeaping::SetEpsilon ( double  eps  ) 

Set the epsilon member to be eps.

User must call this method before calling any simulate function.

void TauLeaping::SetHOR ( StochVector &  hor  ) 

Set the HOR vector of the system's reactions.

User must set this method in order to use the CaoStepSize method.

void TauLeaping::SetIndividualOrder ( StochVector &  individual_order  ) 

Set the individual vector of the system's reactions.

User must set this method in order to use the CaoStepSize method.

void TauLeaping::NextStep_Explicit (  ) 

Use explicit tau leaping method to update the system within one step.

User must call SetTau(double ) before call this method, otherwise it will be invalid.

double TauLeaping::CaoSelectTau ( StochVector &  propensities  ) 

Use cao's method to select the tau.

User must call SetEpsilon and SetHOR before calling this method, otherwise it will be invalid.

Parameters:
propensities StochVector type of argument, CaoSelectTau will use data in this vector to compute the tau.

void TauLeaping::DefaultSetHOR (  ) 

The default highest order of reaction computation.

If user wants to call CaoSelectTau() without initializing HOR vector, then this function will be called. Not implemented yet.

void TauLeaping::ComputePoisson ( double  tau,
StochVector &  propensities,
StochVector &  result 
) [protected]

Compute the poisson vector based on the propensity_vector.

result = poisson(propensities * tau)

The result will be stored in the result object

Member Data Documentation

StochVector TauLeaping::highest_order_rxn [private]

The HOR vector of all the reactions.

This vector should be initialzed by calling SetHOR method.

StochVector TauLeaping::highest_individual_order [private]

The highest order for individual specie.

For example, if in one reaction, there are two different reactants, then both of them have reaction order of 2, and individual order of 1. But if in one reaction, there are one kind of species, but 2 of them are the reactants, then the reaction order is 2, but inidividual order is 1.
